snippet: Edward DeMarco, the regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, said it might make sense for the mortgage finance companies to write down mortgage loan principal.
abstract: Edward J DeMarco, acting director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, opens the door to forgiving some mortgage debt of homeowners who owe more than their houses are worth; says it might make economic sense in some circumstances to allow Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to reduce mortgages, taking a hit to modify the loan while making it less likely that a homeowner will default; warns that policy would have limited benefit and could have significant costs to taxpayers.
lead_paragraph: Edward DeMarco, the regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, said it might make sense for the mortgage finance companies to write down mortgage loan principal.

headline.seo: Fannie and Freddie Regulator Considers Plan for Principal Reduction
